ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Back on-topic - "Twisting" songs...
ygData.msgSnippet: Here is what I am twisting at 24 when grouped: During Melee: Anthem de Arms Guardian Rythyms Largo Melodic Binding (if no enchanter is slow/mezing) or bruscoes
ygData.messageBody:
Here is what I am twisting at 24 when grouped:

During Melee:
Anthem de Arms
Guardian Rythyms
Largo Melodic Binding (if no enchanter is slow/mezing) or bruscoes

I then switch in Selo's Consonant Chain (snare) in place of 2 or 3 when the
mob starts to run.

After melee I run to the casters and start:
Manasong

If people are low on health I will twist in Hymn of Restoration, if they are
really low, I'll swap in my lute for added benefit.

If twisting manasong and Hymn, I let manasong pulse 2 times, then Hymn for
one, mana for 2, etc. Since Hymn is a healing DOT and mansong is not.

Ungrouped I sing the same except I sing Jonthans instead of Largo.

Notebender
Bard of the 24th song
Veeshan



----- Original Message -----
From: "John Grady" <john_grady@...>
To: <eqbards@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 12, 2001 2:22 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Back on-topic - "Twisting" songs...


> My set-up is somewhat similiar, but I rarely use Hymn anymore unless I'm
> soloing. I frequently play Soothing thru the fight if needed (it last 3
> ticks unlike Clarity and has better range) by switching out my lute.
>
> In places like Seb my cleric with have C2 and still be asking for manna
> song. Those froggies hit hard.
>
> As for battle songs, VoV, Bind and Niv's are good if you're playing
> Chanter. If I have both Chanter and Shammy I usually Dot and Sooth. SOS is
> interesting but with no message back, it's too hard for me or my group to
> see my contribution.
>
> Occasionally I'll sing a Psalm for MR, Mob de-buff (hate DSes :-)or what
> have you.
>
> So basically I have 4 hot pads set-up for songs. One like Chris for
> straight twisting, one for switching instruments/weapons, one for Crowd
> Control with pet commands/announcements and one for pulling ("TRAIN!"
> Lol).
>
> Tzeetch
>
> --- Christopher Sanders <christopher.sanders@...> wrote:
>
> I don't manasong during battle, at this point.  No battle should take
> long enough to require it, so it doesn't get twisted.  I'm adamant
> about it, since I spend downtime twisting it and hymn.
>
> Atonal
>
>
